revised_title: Description of the Cereus Flowering in Nuremberg in 1730
tldr: The author describes the unique characteristics and growth patterns of the Cereus Peruvianus, a rare plant that flowered in Nuremberg in 1730. The article provides detailed observations of the plant's morphology, including its green, purple, and white petals, and discusses its reproductive process. The author also addresses common misconceptions about the plant's classification and offers corrections to previous descriptions of the Cereus.
